website_summaries.verdict: This middle-of-the road set works well with metals like cast iron, cast steel, and stainless. It's not as good of choice for materials at either the hard or soft end of the spectrum.
pros: 5-piece set of Tungsten double-cut carbide rotary heads with 1/4" shanks
Intended for deburring and polishing a variety of cast, alloyed and other materials up to HRC65 hardness
Includes: SF-5, SF-3, SL-4, 14-degree cone head, SC-3, cylinder ball head and SC-5 cylinder ball head
cons: A little hard to control in tight areas

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic - had to slightly enlarge a bunch of plasma ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic - had to slightly enlarge a bunch of plasma cut holes from 3/8 to 1/2 in 1/4 plate. Tried a drill press with HSS Ti coated step bits and they did nothing against the hardened edge from the plasma cut. Put this burr in a rotozip set to 15k rpm and it hogged the hardened material right out with very little effort and once past the heat affected zone it REALLY cut the soft steel fast!. Didn't even seem to dull, worked as good for the 40th hole as it did for the 1st one. Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: MDF

customer_reviews.title: Cast iron burr
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cutter . More aggressive than my previous burr. Has less spacing between cutter flutes,making it harder to control in tight areas. Used for porting GM cast iron heads. Great quality for the price,but wish it had less spacing between flutes. That is the only reason I didn't give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome for cleaning up welds
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome for cleaning up welds! I got about 25' of weld bead ground before it started to dull; I could probably get more if I was more careful and didn't bounce the burr against the work piece incorrectly. Note: for the love of dog and all is holy, use eye protection! When I use this with a carbide burr to clean welds, it turns the metal to dust as it grinds, which would play hell with your corneas!
customer_reviews.author: T. Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: great for cutting fiberglass
customer_reviews.text: Durable, great for cutting fiberglass. Only drawback is the dust it creates but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for price.
customer_reviews.text: For 12 dollars this is a great buy, it beats the hell out of pay 60 dollars for one at a welding shop. I work costruction and I love this bit 1/4 inch shaft and 1/2 diameter.
customer_reviews.author: alex fullbright

customer_reviews.title: Tough bit
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bit at the body shop for over a year and it still performs just as good as the day I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Michael Reed

customer_reviews.title: Good burr
customer_reviews.text: Works great, hogs out metal pretty fast, good smooth operation. Fits the 6mm shaft die granders.
customer_reviews.author: Iron Mike

customer_reviews.title: Spoonmaking
customer_reviews.text: I use this in an electric rotary handheld Wecheer flexible shaft grinder to smooth out the "dish" when carving a spoon. Works well after carving removing the ridges left behind.
customer_reviews.author: Gramps

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: in general, all is good, but I'm prefer an individual package
customer_reviews.author: jaime s.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how much I can say about a rotary burr, but it appears to be high quality, is very sharp, and stayed sharp after grinding on some thick, stamped steel.
customer_reviews.author: Roger M.

customer_reviews.title: somewhat better than the inexpensive hardware store product
customer_reviews.text: Seems to remove material, at least relatively soft cast brass, somewhat better than the inexpensive hardware store product. I still have much more shaping to do before a final grade on this tool.
customer_reviews.author: elkay

customer_reviews.title: worked great for the price - its hard to tell what ...
customer_reviews.text: worked great for the price - its hard to tell what size it is but its the exact same performance as one you would get from a tool truck only 1/10th the price :)
customer_reviews.author: T. lopez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool and keeps its edge on hardened steel and removes material quickly. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob K

customer_reviews.title: Good design and performance
customer_reviews.text: I used this to debur stainless steel and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dunwoodytoolman

customer_reviews.title: Beauty!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is beautiful to look at, almost hate to use it. Works fine on stone, nice finish. I especially like the 3 inch size.
customer_reviews.author: Audioeyes

customer_reviews.title: He specifically requested this tool and is very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son in law's birthday. He specifically requested this tool and is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathe Costello

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: The product was received on time and is good quality. I like that the bit has a longer shank. It cuts very well and did not seem to hop when being used, like some other bits like this that I have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: E.P.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic die grinder bit
customer_reviews.text: This bit really goes through the material smoothly and aggressively. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Randall W. Fullmer

customer_reviews.title: cuts through cast iron like butter, would defiantly buy again
customer_reviews.text: bought it to debur the oil drain back holes on my SBC, cuts through cast iron like butter, would defiantly buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp, hard, and great quality. Cuts aluminum like butter. Will order more.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Green

customer_reviews.title: Price and Quality very nice
customer_reviews.text: I use burr bits everyday and all day of all kinds, qualities, and price . These have stayed strong and true these are the go to bits for WI PREP for NDT
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome metal-eating monster!
customer_reviews.text: Really does the job grinding welds. I'm buying more in various shapes.
customer_reviews.author: sciguy

customer_reviews.title: Great metal cutting tool
customer_reviews.text: Great metal cutting tool. Made the job so easy. Don the settle for the cheaper products which is too soft and wears out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Nice burr bit
customer_reviews.text: Nice burr bit. Works really well for what I need it for at work. I clean and paint galvanized parts after they are welded, and it works good for grinding down weld spots that are to big.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Quick working burr
customer_reviews.text: Needed a burr this size and shape for a metal removal project. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: JStuffed

customer_reviews.title: Good burr
customer_reviews.text: Very good tool. I just ground down six feet of 6061 T6 aluminum sliding door track and the burr stayed sharp and never loaded up.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. White

customer_reviews.title: Carbide Burr
customer_reviews.text: I use this burr for aluminum prep prior to TIG welding. It works better than others I've used. It has a little more coarse teeth and doesn't plug as easily as others.
customer_reviews.author: Cameryn Faehnrich

customer_reviews.title: A+++++ Used at auto shop regularly. Just what I ...
customer_reviews.text: A+++++ Used at auto shop regularly. Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: ... used one of these but seem to be a good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have only used one of these but seem to be a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Scoggin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts well doesn't load up to bad use it in production setting small scale
customer_reviews.author: dikfer

customer_reviews.title: Carbide Burr
customer_reviews.text: I use this burr for aluminum prep prior to TIG welding. It works better than others I've used. It has a little more coarse teeth and doesn't plug as easily as others.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Robbins

customer_reviews.title: cant go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Really nice product for the price. Well made, good packaging. Works brilliantly on mild steel so far. Hope it lasts well.
customer_reviews.author: madcapmagician

customer_reviews.title: Great cutting tool !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product cuts better than other brands I have tried, and a good price as well. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Gary F.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts quickly! I've cut a few holes already, no sign of slowing down.
customer_reviews.author: Bart B.

customer_reviews.title: Legit!
customer_reviews.text: After 4 hours of porting a cast iron exhaust manifold, thing is still holding strong!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: USED THIS TOOL TODAY, WORKS AS WELL AS TOOLS COSTING TWICE AS MUCH
customer_reviews.author: D. Phillis

customer_reviews.title: These are great, but they do not last as long as ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great, but they do not last as long as their straight cylinder burrs (which are excellent as well). I assume because of the focused curved surface.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for Aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Loads up and gets clogged easily when porting & polishing an aluminum engine head.
customer_reviews.author: Warlord1026

customer_reviews.title: Good burr
customer_reviews.text: Great burr. I have mostly used this on cast iron and other hard materials. Works pretty well with good durability.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

product_meta.title: TEMO 5 pc Set Double Cut Carbide Rotary Burr File Tool, 1/2 Inch (12.7 mm) and 3/8 Inch (9.5 mm) Heads, 1/4 Inch (6.35 mm) Diameter 2 Inch (50.8 mm) Long Shank
product_meta.description:
Size:2" 5pc ComboTEMO 5 pc Set Double Cut Carbide Rotary Burr File Tool, 1/2 Inch (12.7 mm) and 3/8 Inch (9.5 mm) Heads, 1/4 Inch (6.35 mm) Diameter 2 Inch (50.8 mm) Long Shank

 * 5 pc TUNGSTEN Double Cut CARBIDE ROTARY BURR TOOL SET 1/4" (6.35mm) SHANK 
 * Burrs have double cut head with exact 1/4" (6.35mm) shank and 1/2" (12.7mm) or 3/8" (9.52mm) head diameters. 
 *  All burrs are made with tungsten carbide and are suitable for deburring and polishing cast iron, cast steel, carbon steel, alloy steel, stainless steel and other materials up to HRC65 hardness. 
 *  Includes heavy duty carry case. 
 *  This set contains 5 different burrs: SF-5 (1/2" (12.7mm) round tree head), SF-3 (3/8" (9.52mm) round tree head), SL-4 (1/2" (12.7mm) 14 degree cone head), SC-3 (3/8" (9.52mm) cylinder ball head), and SC-5 (1/2" (12.7mm) cylinder ball head). Includes head shapes for most projects.


Please visit completed TEMO product line at our store front at: www.amazon.com/temo


TEMO is a registered trademark of Golden Coulee, LLC and Golden Coulee is the sole authorized seller of TEMO brand products. Counterfeit products may be unsafe, not made to the correct safety standards, and may be of poor quality. Golden Coulee reserves the right to pursue unauthorized use of the TEMO trademark to the fullest extent of the law.
feature_bullets: 5 pc TUNGSTEN Double Cut CARBIDE ROTARY BURR TOOL SET 1/4" (6.35mm) SHANK
Burrs have double cut head with exact 1/4" (6.35mm) shank and 1/2" (12.7mm) or 3/8" (9.52mm) head diameters.
All burrs are made with tungsten carbide and are suitable for deburring and polishing cast iron, cast steel, carbon steel, alloy steel, stainless steel and other materials up to HRC65 hardness.

This set contains 5 different burrs: SF-5 (1/2" (12.7mm) round tree head), SF-3 (3/8" (9.52mm) round tree head), SL-4 (1/2" (12.7mm) 14 degree cone head), SC-3 (3/8" (9.52mm) cylinder ball head), and SC-5 (1/2" (12.7mm) cylinder ball head). Includes head shapes for most projects.
